summary: This document is an email chain between U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) personnel regarding the logistics of picking up and distributing a signed 6(e) order from Judge Alison Nathan related to the Jeffrey Epstein case. The order concerns grand jury secrecy rules.

persons.name: Judge Nathan
persons.context: The judge who signed the 6(e) order related to the Epstein case. Her clerk notified the U.S. Attorney's Office that the order was ready for pickup.

events.title: Judge Nathan Signs 6(e) Order
events.description: Judge Alison Nathan signed an order related to Federal Rule of Criminal Procedure 6(e), which governs grand jury secrecy, in the Jeffrey Epstein case. The order was made ready for pickup from her chambers.

events.title: Order Picked Up and Scanned
events.description: A representative from the U.S. Attorney's Office picked up the hard copy of the signed 6(e) order from Judge Nathan's chambers, had it scanned, and distributed it via email to the relevant parties.

keyFacts: A 6(e) order concerning grand jury secrecy in the Jeffrey Epstein case was signed by Judge Alison Nathan on or before January 31, 2020.
The order was initially delivered in hard copy to a recipient, but was then retrieved, scanned, and distributed electronically by the U.S. Attorney's Office on February 3, 2020.
The email chain shows coordination within the U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) regarding the procedural step of obtaining and disseminating a court order.
